resources.string: You need 1 sensor for this exercise. Please clip it on the top of the t-shirt as displayed in the image below.
Kneel upright in neutral spine position, arms resting by side and palms on outer thighs.
Keeping hand in contact with the side of leg, reach down towards the floor. Hold this position for 10 seconds. Return trunk back to start position through the same movement line.
3 times right then 3 times to the left
To help maintain or increase your ability to side bend the waist.
If dizziness is experiences, discontinue the exercise and see medical review.

Do not allow yourself to bend forwards or backwards during movement.\n
Do not allow yourself to rotate/turn your trunk.\n
Keep shoulders relaxed.\n
Ensure hips and pelvis remain still facing forward.\n
Maintain even weight through your knees throughout the movement. Do not allow the opposite knee to lift.\n
Ensure slow continuous movement throughout.
An image to show how the exercise should be performed.
Good Job! Done with this exercise
GOOD JOB! RIGHT SIDE DONE. Start with left bend in
Kneeling upright, with arms across chest and neutral spine position.
Turn/Rotate trunk from the waist as far round as you can. Hold this position for 10 seconds. Return trunk back to start position through the same movement.
To help maintain or increase your ability to rotate trunk.

Keep eyes level - do not look down to the floor or tip head to ceiling.\n
Do not allow yourself to bend forward or backwards during movement.\n
Relax shoulders back and down.\n
Ensure hips and pelvis remain still, facing forward.\n
Maintain even weight through your knees throughout the movement. Do not allow the opposite knee to lift.\n
Ensure slow continuous movement throughout.
The sensor ID can be found on the back of the sensor, as in the picture below.

Maintain neutral spine position throughout movement.

Use buttocks and spinal muscles to complete movement. Do not push through arms and feet to achieve movements.

Each action and return should be done slowly and in a controlled way.
Lie on your back, knees bent up and feet on the floor at hip distnace apart. Arms resting by side, palms down.
Lift buttocks and lower back off the floor into a bridging position. Hold this position for 5 seconds. Return back to start position through the same movement line.
To help maintain or increase strength in the buttocks and lower spine.
You need one sensor for this exercise. Please clip it on the middle of the belt as displayed in the image below.
The sensor is sensitive to placement and orientation. Make sure the sensor orientation is as displayed with the grey circle on the lower right hand corner.
